mn1:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Ukkaṭṭhā, in the Subhaga Forest at the root of a magnificent sal tree.
mn1:1.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,
mn1:2.1: “Mendicants, I will teach you the explanation of the root of all things.
mn1:2.2: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
mn1:3.1: “Take an uneducated ordinary person who has not seen the noble ones, and is neither skilled nor trained in the teaching of the noble ones. They’ve not seen good persons, and are neither skilled nor trained in the teaching of the good persons.
mn1:3.3: But then they identify with earth, they identify regarding earth, they identify as earth, they identify that ‘earth is mine’, they take pleasure in earth.
mn1:3.5: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:4.2: But then they identify with water …
mn1:4.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:5.2: But then they identify with fire …
mn1:5.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:6.2: But then they identify with air …
mn1:6.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:7.2: But then they identify with creatures …
mn1:7.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:8.2: But then they identify with gods …
mn1:8.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:9.1: They perceive the Creator as the Creator.
mn1:9.2: But then they identify with the Creator …
mn1:9.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:10.2: But then they identify with Brahmā …
mn1:10.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:11.1: They perceive the gods of streaming radiance as the gods of streaming radiance.
mn1:11.2: But then they identify with the gods of streaming radiance …
mn1:11.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:12.1: They perceive the gods replete with glory as the gods replete with glory.
mn1:12.2: But then they identify with the gods replete with glory …
mn1:12.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:13.1: They perceive the gods of abundant fruit as the gods of abundant fruit.
mn1:13.2: But then they identify with the gods of abundant fruit …
mn1:13.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:14.1: They perceive the Overlord as the Overlord.
mn1:14.2: But then they identify with the Overlord …
mn1:14.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:15.1: They perceive the dimension of infinite space as the dimension of infinite space.
mn1:15.2: But then they identify with the dimension of infinite space …
mn1:15.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:16.1: They perceive the dimension of infinite consciousness as the dimension of infinite consciousness.
mn1:16.2: But then they identify with the dimension of infinite consciousness …
mn1:16.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:17.1: They perceive the dimension of nothingness as the dimension of nothingness.
mn1:17.2: But then they identify with the dimension of nothingness …
mn1:17.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:18.1: They perceive the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception as the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.
mn1:18.2: But then they identify with the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception …
mn1:18.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:19.1: They perceive the seen as the seen.
mn1:19.2: But then they identify with the seen …
mn1:19.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:20.1: They perceive the heard as the heard.
mn1:20.2: But then they identify with the heard …
mn1:20.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:21.1: They perceive the thought as the thought.
mn1:21.2: But then they identify with the thought …
mn1:21.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:22.1: They perceive the known as the known.
mn1:22.2: But then they identify with the known …
mn1:22.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:23.2: But then they identify with oneness …
mn1:23.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:24.2: But then they identify with diversity …
mn1:24.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:25.2: But then they identify with all …
mn1:25.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:26.2: But then they identify with extinguishment, they identify regarding extinguishment, they identify as extinguishment, they identify that ‘extinguishment is mine’, they take pleasure in extinguishment.
mn1:26.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:27.1: A mendicant who is a trainee, who hasn’t achieved their heart’s desire, but lives aspiring to the supreme sanctuary, directly knows earth as earth.
mn1:27.2: But they shouldn’t identify with earth, they shouldn’t identify regarding earth, they shouldn’t identify as earth, they shouldn’t identify that ‘earth is mine’, they shouldn’t take pleasure in earth.
mn1:27.4: So that they may completely understand it, I say.

mn1:51.1: A mendicant who is perfected—with defilements ended, who has completed the spiritual journey, done what had to be done, laid down the burden, achieved their own true goal, utterly ended the fetters of rebirth, and is rightly freed through enlightenment—directly knows earth as earth.
mn1:51.2: But they don’t identify with earth, they don’t identify regarding earth, they don’t identify as earth, they don’t identify that ‘earth is mine’, they don’t take pleasure in earth.
mn1:51.4: Because they have completely understood it, I say.

mn1:147.1: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha directly knows earth as earth.
mn1:147.2: But he doesn’t identify with earth, he doesn’t identify regarding earth, he doesn’t identify as earth, he doesn’t identify that ‘earth is mine’, he doesn’t take pleasure in earth.
mn1:147.4: Because the Realized One has completely understood it to the end, I say.

mn1:171.1: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha directly knows earth as earth.
mn1:171.2: But he doesn’t identify with earth, he doesn’t identify regarding earth, he doesn’t identify as earth, he doesn’t identify that ‘earth is mine’, he doesn’t take pleasure in earth.
mn1:171.4: Because he has understood that relishing is the root of suffering,
mn1:171.5: and that rebirth comes from continued existence; whoever has come to be gets old and dies.
mn1:171.6: That’s why the Realized One—with the ending, fading away, cessation, giving up, and letting go of all cravings—has awakened to the supreme perfect Awakening, I say.
